title: India faces second-highest economic burden due to diabetes; doctor explains growing crisis
description: India faces the second-highest economic burden from diabetes globally, a new study reveals. With 11.4% of the population diabetic and 15.3% prediabetic, experts emphasize that borderline diabetes is reversible. Lifestyle changes, including weight loss and regular exercise, are crucial to prevent progression to type 2 diabetes. Early action offers a chance to alter the health trajectory.

description: India’s US education boom has been built on a quiet assumption that OPT will give graduates time to work, earn, and attempt longer-term visas. For Indian students and families, the risk is obvious: Degree stays costly, but the payoff window shrinks.

Rial Collapse Protests: Iran faces largest unrest in decades; over 2,000 killed, 10,000 arrested
description: Iran faces widespread unrest fueled by economic collapse, not ideology. The rial's sharp decline triggered strikes and protests across all provinces, impacting ordinary citizens and the middle class. This broad-based challenge, marked by significant deaths and arrests, strikes at the regime's core ability to provide economic survival, making it a critical juncture for the Islamic Republic.

25% tariff threat: Trump’s Iran move rattles Xi; will it upend US-China truce?
description: US President Trump has threatened a 25% tariff on any nation trading with Iran, potentially jeopardizing the US-China trade truce. This move, aimed at increasing pressure on Tehran amidst internal unrest, could significantly impact China, Iran's largest trading partner, and create complex challenges for India, Japan, South Korea, and Turkey.

title: Stranger Things creators accused of using ChatGPT for finale script
description: The Duffer Brothers are facing backlash after screenshots from a 'Stranger Things' documentary appeared to show ChatGPT tabs open during scriptwriting. Fans are alleging AI was used for the finale, leading to widespread disappointment and online uproar. While no official confirmation exists, the images have fueled intense speculation about the show's creative process.

title: 'Take them to your house': SC questions those feeding stray dogs; compensation warning for states
description: The Supreme Court warned states of heavy compensation for inaction on stray dog bites, particularly affecting children and the elderly. The bench also demanded accountability from dog feeders, suggesting they house the animals. The court emphasized its focus on Animal Birth Control rules and flagged non-compliance by civic bodies, leading to deaths from bites and accidents.

title: Travis Kelce’s wedding rule for Taylor Swift raises eyebrows
description: Travis Kelce revealed he is already thinking carefully about his wedding to Taylor Swift, especially the seating chart. Speaking on his podcast, Kelce said he prioritizes guest chemistry and would rather not invite someone than seat them awkwardly. He also shared excitement about introducing Swift as his fiancée to teammates and celebrating their engagement privately.
